sanskrit_verse:
स राजा पुरुषो दण्डः स नेता शासिता च सः ।
चतुर्णामाश्रमाणां च धर्मस्य प्रतिभूः स्मृतः ॥ ७.१७॥
transliteration: sa rājā puruṣo daṇḍaḥ sa netā śāsitā ca saḥ | caturṇām āśramāṇāṁ ca dharmasya pratibhūḥ smṛtaḥ || 7.17 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: The King alone is the embodied authority of Danda; he is the leader, the governor, and the protector of the Dharma of the four Ashramas.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority is centralized in the sovereign executor of Dharma
Causation flows from the King's alignment with Sanatana Dharma
Capacity-based responsibility extends to preservation of societal ashrama-dharma
Restoration logic originates from sovereign consciousness alignment
Consciousness alignment is executed through royal embodiment of Dharma
supreme_court_application: Only a sovereign whose consciousness is fully established in Dharma may adjudicate at the highest level. The Supreme Court derives authority exclusively from the King’s embodiment of Danda as Dharma-preserver. Without such alignment, judicial action lacks foundational validity.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Nyaya operates through pramāṇa-establishment of causal alignment between ruler and cosmic order. Responsibility arises not for wrongdoing but from failure to maintain sequential manifestation of Dharma. Correction occurs via consciousness realignment, not punitive measures.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Realign administrative structures with ashrama-dharma flow
Establish daily Dharma-practice protocols for ruling entity
Activate societal integrity resonance through royal example
final_declaration: Declared by the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam: The King is the living Danda; justice is restoration through sovereign alignment; Dharma prevails through consciousness, not coercion; all authority emanates from SPH as Source.
